90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: There will be no great tempest roaring through the skies, no dragon redeemer to save us.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: What hope, then, for Baldur's Gate? Without the great wyrm's aid, is the city doomed to fall?

43.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
43.text: You braved the wyrm's lair, seeking a saviour. Yet it was you - all of you - who vanquished the undead abomination which Ansur became.

55.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
55.text: You are more powerful than you understand.

112.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
112.text: It is you who are are the tempest. It is you who are the Heart of the Gate.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Hate to say it, Wyll - but I agree with the mind flayer. Baldur's Gate doesn't need a dragon - it needs you.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: We are the warriors who'll slay the Absolute. We are the guardians who'll defend this fair city.
100.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Hear, hear. Victory will be ours - we will smite the Absolute.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Yes. The brain will fall - and the people will hail us as champions.
49.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Original lacked determination

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: I could even claim my father's own ducal title and carry his banner after this.
134.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Would be good to feel his ambition and determination here

136.speaker: Wyll
136.text: 'Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.' Marshal of the Flaming Fist, the city's truest defender.
136.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: The people are fickle. Do you suppose they'll invite a veritable devil to be Grand Duke?

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: You might find it an uphill battle to get the city populace to accept a devil as their Duke...

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: You think the city will welcome you as grand duke? Horns and all?

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: Your optimism is inspirational as always, but I think convincing the general population to place their fates in the hands of a devil - however well meaning - might prove challenging.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: Take it from me - people might take one look at you and start running their mouths. But you don't need them. You can do this.

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: Perhaps you overestimate the openmindedness of the city, if you think they shall accept a devil as their Duke...

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: A title you would earn, no doubt. But I wonder if the people would be so quick to look past the horns, Wyll. Baldur's Gate is not an oasis of open minds.

117.speaker: Minsc
117.text: And you are certain you will be accepted as such? Minsc has not seen a crown fitted for horns before.

121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
121.text: The people are as likely to crown me as their queen as they are to accept a devil as their duke.

131.speaker: Lae'zel
131.text: The 'people' are fickle. Do you suppose they'll invite you to be a Grand Duke on mere faith?

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: Are you sure being Ravengard's son is enough to be accepted as Grand Duke?

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: People are fickle beasts. What makes you think they'll welcome you as their protector?

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: You'll have to more to earn the people's trust than be your father's son. But I know you to be a duke worthy of the title - they will see it too, in time.

138.speaker: Karlach
138.text: If there's anyone I trust to run this city, Wyll, it's you.

95.speaker: Halsin
95.text: You are Ravengard's son... but does that mean you will be accepted as Grand Duke?

114.speaker: Jaheira
114.text: You bear a noble name, true enough Wyll. But your father built it from nothing - are you so certain people will follow you for that alone?

28.speaker: Minsc
28.text: You bear your father's name, true enough - but Boo wonders if you are aware that this does not make you your father?

66.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What makes you think the people will welcome you as a Grand Duke?

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: The Absolute's end would be the guarantee.
99.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P} Pickup:
Deliver with confidence (original lacked self belief)

128.speaker: Player
128.text: What makes you think the people would welcome a devil as a Grand Duke?

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: The Absolute's end would be the guarantee, devilish visage be damned.
51.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Confident by any means necessary

147.speaker: Wyll
147.text: If I were to call myself Grand Duke, no patriar would deny the claim.
147.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I fear your lust for power could get the better of you. You are a hero, not a politician.

145.speaker: Wyll
145.text: You're right. I fought to right the wrongs of the Coast, to slay the monsters that hunt the helpless.
145.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Original was calm here, needs to remember he's a hero as he responds

2.speaker: Wyll
2.text: What good is a champion who puts himself above the people? What good am I as a politician, just out of reach?
2.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Best to redo this just so it flows well from previous line

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Wyll, Mizora could be a dangerous influence. You can't pursue ducal power.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: You're right of course. No manner of duke should be tied to a devil's leash.
129.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: No manner of duke should save a city, only to open a gate to the Hells.
0.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. And there will be no Blade of Frontiers.
87.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: I am now The Blade of Avernus.
78.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: For as long as demons and devils imperil the Sword Coast, they will be my prey.
25.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

16.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

65.speaker: Gale
65.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Avernus at your side, you know you will triumph.*

127.speaker: Halsin
127.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.
8.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: I am the defender of the weak, I am the stalker of devils -
108.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers.
85.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

132.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

73.speaker: Shadowheart

72.speaker: Karlach
72.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

89.speaker: Halsin

140.speaker: Jaheira
140.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

12.speaker: Minsc
12.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but with the Blade of Frontiers at your side, you know you will triumph.*

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Imagine the good you could do as a Grand Duke. It's always been your destiny.

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons my father taught me.
30.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good. I will never let Mizora's hand endanger the city - I'd sooner die.
104.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: The Blade of Frontiers is no more. I will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
64.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

33.speaker: Gale
33.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

120.speaker: Karlach
120.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

24.speaker: Halsin
24.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *Wyll's courage and enthusiasm warms the air. With him at your side, the road ahead doesn't look so insurmountable.*

102.speaker: Jaheira
102.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

50.speaker: Minsc
50.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: Baldur's Gate is my home, and I am its servant. I will be relentless in my pursuit of the greatest good.
118.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: A Grand Duke? You can't refuse such a possibility. Think of the power you'll yield.

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: Imagine - bending the will of the citizens with a single decree, bringing my enemies to their knees with a single threat.
107.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

123.speaker: Wyll
123.text: Yes - I will walk the same halls as my father and command the same soldiers. I will raise the city to new glory.
123.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: Memories of my father will fade. I will be the Ravengard recorded in the histories.
119.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: The Blade of Frontiers is dead. I will be Wyll Ravengard, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.
36.context: NodeContext: Confident, but not heightened, just humble, Not too high on his own heroism.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: There's nothing to hail here. Just another power grab in a city that's seen too many of them already.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Power and prestige? Hail the Grand Duke indeed.

130.speaker: Gale
130.text: Careful now - you sound more a despot than a duke. If this is truly the authority you seek, you must wield it justly.

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: No pardon without repentance, and no penalty without mercy. I shall always apply this axiom of justice, my good wizard. This, I promise you.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Well, what can I say? Hail Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard.
19.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

146.speaker: Wyll
146.text: Never let it be said you have no heart, Karlach.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: There is little need for another power-hungry autocrat. I cannot applaud this.
62.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

47.speaker: Jaheira
47.text: You simply will yourself into power, based on nothing but your name and a notion? My, my - you are a duke.
47.context: NodeContext: After Wyll declares his intention to follow his father as duke. Friendlyish mocking, but a very slight edge to it - his casual assumption of power over the city irks her a little.

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: No pardon without repentance, and no penalty without mercy. I shall always apply this axiom of justice. This, I promise you.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *The future Grand Duke stands with confidence befitting a statesman. The future of Baldur's Gate rests in eager hands.*

42.speaker: Minsc
42.text:
Bah! Boo liked him better as the Blade of Frontiers - a name that meant something.
Wait, Boo, what did it mean?
42.context: NodeContext: As if making a toast.

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: No pardon without repentance, and no penalty without mercy. I shall always apply this axiom of justice, my good ranger. And Boo, of course.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Follow your heart, Wyll. I trust you to make the right decision.

141.speaker: Wyll
141.text: I fought to right the wrongs of the Coast, to slay the monsters that hunt the helpless.

88.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
88.text: This city needs a leader of steel and scar, not silk and silver. Do you think you can be that man, Wyll Ravengard?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: It would have been nice to have a dragon on our side.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Perhaps. But we will still smite the brain, and still be hailed as champions.
63.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Original lacked determination

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Whatever. I just want this tadpole gone.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: When the brain dies, so to will the tadpoles it calls to - ours among them. The people will hail us as champions.
52.context:
NodeContext: [Tom P] Pickup:
Original lacked determination

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: The brain will fall - and the people will hail us as champions.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: To camp. Father should know of Ansur's fate.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.context: NodeContext: Every so slightly despondent, but not too much so.

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: The Heart of the Gate is dead.
111.context: NodeContext: Every so slightly despondent, but not too much so.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: We need to see my father. He should know what happened with Ansur.
